The City of Caldwell Municipal Court’s mission is to provide access to a fair and impartial judicial system that is dedicated to administering justice with the utmost respect, integrity, and professionalism while providing excellent customer service in an effective and efficient manner so that public trust and confidence in the judicial system is upheld.

![](../ic?i=money&c3=%23ffffff&c2=transparent&c1=transparent)
![](../ic?i=gavel&c3=%23ffffff&c2=transparent&c1=transparent)

You must enter your Plea form by Mail, Email, Fax, or in person within 10 days of receiving your citation.

You may Pay the Fine to the Municipal Court Fine in full using a credit or debit card. You are given the option of citation number or driver license number along with your date of birth.  (Note for citation please add the last two-digit year your citation was received example: citation number 2536 was the issued year 2019 now its 2536-19)

If you plead guilty or no contest, the fine may be paid online, by mail, or in-person with a money order or credit/debit card. If you need payment arrangement please contact the court for your options. . If you are unable to pay the fine and fees, there are alternative methods to satisfy payment of any fines or fees owed. You may appear or contact the court to discuss your options.

For more information, please contact the Court at
[979-567](javascript:;)
-3271 ext. 300

[Plea Reply Form.](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/municipalcourt#occdrw)

The court will notify you by mail of your trial date and time to appear. You must advise the court a correct mailing address.

All our Trial Hearings are held at Caldwell Civic Center (103 TX 21 West Caldwell, Texas 77836)

If you are not able to make your trial date you will need to contact the court at least 24 hours in advance.

For more information contact the court at 979-567-3271 ext. 300

1. Have not completed a Driver Safety Course within the past 12 months.

Violations Occurring in a Constructions Zone while Workers Present are not eligible for DSC or Deferred Dispositions. Submit the following documents plea reply form/affidavit (link) within 10 days along with following items below.

You may submit forms and documents via email or fax and call in your payment of $146.00 to the court with a credit or debit card.

You will not receive a formal notice to take the Drive Safety Course. Once documents and payment is submitted you will have 90 days to complete the course.

* may be dismissed upon proof of renewal to the court within 20 working days from the date of the citation.
* may be dismissed upon proof of renewal and penalty fee paid to the Tax Office when registration is being renewed, and present to the Court within 20 working days.
* may be dismissed upon presenting proof of equipment repair within 10 days of citation.
* may be dismissed if Insurance was valid at the time of stop, must be presented within 10 days of citation with no dismissal fee.

All Juveniles 16 years and younger are required to appear in front of the Judge with a Parent/Guardian. The parent/ guardian must contact the Court to schedule an appearance date.

All Minors under 17 years of age with an Alcohol or Tobacco offense must appear in front of the Judge with a Parent/ Guardian. The parent/ guardian must contact the court to schedule an appearance date.

All Minors under the age of 21 with an Alcohol or Tobacco related offense must appear in front of the Judge. You must contact the court to schedule an appearance date.

Violations of the City Ordinance may carry a maximum fine of up to $2,000. The judge may assess the fine at his/her discretion within the fine range.

Alcohol beverage, Commercial license and weight, and any other offenses not listed contact the court.

Fine may be paid online, by mail, or in person with a money order or credit/debit card. If you need payment arrangement please contact the court for your options. . If you are unable to pay the fine and fees, there are alternative methods to satisfy payment of any fines or fees owed. You may appear or contact the court to discuss your options.

For more information contact the court at 979-567-3271 ext.300
